person.persName: Hartwell T. Burge (Kentucky, chaplain and colonel)

body.p: Kentucky, chaplain and colonel. Virginia native. Married to Mary Jane Hartwell. Father of Phebe T. Burge, Martha Burge, Mary F. Burge, Daniel Burge, and Virginia Burge. Methodist clergyman in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Chaplain in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from December 13, 1861 to June 23, 1863. Promoted to Colonel of the 48th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from October 15, 1863 to December 19, 1864. Commanded Post of Bowling Green, Kentucky, District of Kentucky, Department of the Ohio, from January 1864 to March 1864. Commanded Post of Munfordville, Kentucky, District of Kentucky, Department of the Ohio, from April 1864 to August 1864.
